plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A tall, fragrant lily native to the Balkans and the eastern Mediterranean. It blooms with large, white, trumpet-shaped flowers that emit a sweet scent, often used symbolically in art and religious contexts.
plants.funFact: Madonna Lily flowers have been cultivated since ancient times and were prized for their fragrance and purity symbol.

plants.name: Echinacea purpurea
plants.description: A robust perennial native to eastern North America, featuring large, daisy-like flowers with rosy-purple petals and prominent spiny central cones. It thrives in prairies and open woodlands.
plants.funFact: Echinacea is widely used in herbal medicine for its purported immune-boosting properties.

plants.name: Delosperma cooperi
plants.description: A succulent groundcover native to South Africa, producing vibrant magenta flowers that open in full sun and close at night. It is drought-tolerant and often used in rock gardens and erosion control.
plants.location: South Africa, cultivated in temperate regions
plants.funFact: The ice plant's leaves contain glistening epidermal cells that look like ice crystals, giving it its common name.

plants.name: Tropaeolum majus
plants.description: A fast-growing annual vine or trailing plant with round leaves and bright, zesty flowers ranging from yellow to deep orange and red. Popular in gardens for edible flowers and leaves.
plants.funFact: Nasturtium flowers and leaves are edible, with a peppery flavor often used in salads.
